text:
Late to the party, but

It's hard to try and explain it to content managers or other not that technical people how to create rows outside of having prefabricated dnd rows or saved sections.

IMO when adding a column the row should be created explicitly since the hierarchy is area > section > row > column?

Obvs I can think of cases where due to settings or developer the addition of a row produces unwanted side effects but :shrug:
Ability to use macros with payload-like object format, i.e. `{% macro do_something ({ name, description, id }) %}`
